data.text:
As we're bundling up during the cold San Francisco winter and look back upon an incredible 2025 for team Arini and the dental industry as a whole, we're thrilled to announce a few incredible additions to the team!

Starting off, we couldn't be more excited to introduce Felipe Radovitzky to Arini as Growth Lead.

Most recently, Felipe led operations and growth at Amira, where he helped take a innovative hardware product from 0 to 1 and ship it to hundreds of users. With a mechanical engineering background from MIT and as a former founder, Felipe brings a rare combination of technical depth and executional rigor. We’re excited about the firepower he brings as he teams up with our already world-class growth team members Eric Johnson and Bryan Carbaugh.

After an unforgettable chapter, I’m stepping down from Amira, a dream that started over 5 years ago, became real mid-2022 and shaped me in ways I’ll carry forever.

Being a founder is a life lived in extremes. Relentless urgency, unreasonable optimism, constant uncertainty, and moments of pure joy. Amira was all of that and much, much more.

I’m very proud of what the company has achieved. We built an integrated hardware-software product from the ground up and shipped it to hundreds of women. Getting the product to work in the real world was without a doubt the hardest and most energizing challenge of my career.

But the most rewarding part wasn’t the engineering victories or the product milestones. It was hearing from women who told us that Terra was transforming their sleep and making them feel like themselves again the next day. Our product genuinely changed lives. As a founder, those moments fuel you in ways nothing else does. They make every late night, every iteration, every tough decision worth it.

I’m grateful for the team I had the privilege of building Amira with. Their brilliance and resilience made it an incredible ride. I’ll always root for Loewen, Emilio, and the Amira mission.

Today, I’m excited to share my next step: I’ve joined Arini as a Growth Lead.

Arini is a rare breed where ambition, rigor, and excellence truly align. The mission is clear, the pace is electric, and the people are some of the sharpest, most thoughtful builders I’ve ever met. It feels unreal to be joining Abdul, Rami, Bryan, Eric, Tanner, Abizer, and the rest of this insanely stacked team. I’m thrilled to bring everything I learned as a founder into this next chapter.

I’m profoundly excited for what’s ahead, grateful for the past, and beyond excited by the chance to help build something extraordinary.

Onwards.

resharedPost.text:
We had an incredible time at the Harvard Business School Entrepreneurship Summit, hosted by the HBS Entrepreneurship Club, and sponsored by Xfund, Greenberg Traurig, LLP, Mercury, wiggin(x), Carta, and Stripe.

The event brought together an impressive lineup of industry leaders shaping the future of entrepreneurship, including:
- Aravind Srinivas– CEO @ Perplexity
- Qasar Younis – CEO @ Applied Intuition 
- Faisal Younus – CEO @ Pillar
- Dareen Salama – CEO @ Gryps
- Wale lawal, Ph. D. – Co-Founder @ Mesa Quantum (i-lab alum)
- Matthew Wozny – VP Product & Strategy @ Legacy (i-lab alum)
- Felipe Radovitzky - Co-Founder and COO Amira Health (i-lab alum)

Each speaker brought a unique perspective to the table. Salama shared how to identify the right hire for a technical team. Lawal spoke on founder identity and storytelling. Younus explored the benefit of discussing your product with influencers. Srinivas discussed the importance of open-source models in preventing monopolies.

Events like these are a goldmine for learning entrepreneurial insights and connecting with incredible people across industries.

Huge thanks to the Entrepreneurship Club team for putting on such a fantastic summit!

data.text:
Had a great time speaking at the Harvard Business School Entrepreneurship Summit about Amira Health's journey so far.

Really enjoyed the panel on Building the Right Technical Team and sharing lessons about building in deep tech with Doug Williams Dareen Salama and Matthew Wozny.

Other talks included Aravind Srinivas on the pace of AI evolution and roadmap planning in an era of exponential change, and Qasar Younis on knowing when to go all in on a startup—and when to walk away.

Thanks Faisal Younus for the invite and Alex Gedalin for hosting an awesome event. Honored to be among brilliant founders and builders.

data.text:
One of my closest friends is hiring SWEs.

Alvaro scaled his last healthcare startup from $0 to 8-figure ARR in two years. 

If you're in NY (or willing to move there) and you want to join the #1 executer in early stage healthcare, reach out.

Disclosure: you will work harder than ever under his leadership. But the upside will guaranteed be tremendous.

Calling for founding engineers! Join us and transform healthcare.

We’re hiring our first engineer at Codes Health, and I’m thrilled to share this opportunity to be part of something truly special.

At Codes Health, we’re tackling one of the most frustrating and overlooked pain points in healthcare: the endless hassle of gathering, reviewing, and summarizing medical records. It’s a problem I experienced firsthand as a healthcare executive and one that inspired me to build the solution I wish I’d had.

Healthcare is deeply personal to me. While running a home health agency, I saw families struggle because they couldn’t access the information they needed fast enough. Lives and livelihoods were put on hold because of outdated systems. I knew there had to be a better way, and that’s why I started Codes Health – to give people and providers time back to focus on care, not paperwork.

As our first engineering hire, you’ll have the opportunity to work directly with me and our customers to build out our platform from the ground up. This is the kind of role where you’ll own entire projects, work closely with customers, and see the impact of your work in real time.

We are funded by great investors (Y Combinator, Semil Shah @ Haystack, General Catalyst, and more) and are moving with speed. 

There are very few opportunities where you can have this much impact, autonomy, and growth. 

We are working fully in-person out of our offices in Soho, NY. 

If that energizes you, let’s talk. Reach out or apply below!

https://lnkd.in/gzp_avht

data.text:
People pair hot flashes with menopause but did you know that many breastfeeding and postpartum moms suffer from hot flashes too?

It's been fantastic to partner with Amira Health.  Amira offers Terra - the first automatic cooling pad to sleep through hot flashes. The Bracelet tracks your sweat levels. When your body needs it, the Pad cools you so you sleep uninterrupted.

Thank you Felipe Radovitzky and the Amira Health team for trusting our Mom Creators community to raise awareness about this much-needed product.

Happy Mother’s Day! 💐 

In honor of the remarkable women who have shaped us, we’re excited to announce the early beta access launch of Terra!

Designed to mitigate hot flashes, Terra offers much-needed relief to women experiencing menopause. Terra symbolizes our commitment to unlocking the potential of women, empowering them to embrace life fully.

We only have a limited number of units available in our beta batch, make sure to gift yours today!

And don’t forget, all your mom wants for #MothersDay is a good night of sleep. 😴 

#mothersday #menopause #midlifewellness

What if we looked at our bodies as electrical circuits? 

After all, we should: Electricity is foundational to the body, right down to the cellular level.

Don’t take it from me, though. Loewen Cavill, co-founder and CEO of Amira Health, joined Rajat Suri and me on the pod to talk about the breakthroughs that can happen when we apply a new lens to science.

Check out the full podcast at the link in comments!

data.text:
Suffering in silence has been a common painkiller for women entering menopause.

🌿 Unlike suffering, menopause is a journey that’s not optional; it’s a natural phase of life.

📣 We launched Hot Topic: a series of virtual events where menopause experts amplify their voices, acting as a microphone plugged into the world to help you navigate menopause confidently by discovering a range of relief options, including cutting-edge technological innovations.

👩‍⚕️ We are honored to welcome a valued friend of the Amira team, Dr Anat Sapan, MD, a board-certified OBGYN, and Menopause specialist, for a masterclass on perimenopause, taking place on Thursday, April 25th at 2pm PT/5pm ET.

💪 Extend the gift of empowerment and enablement through knowledge to those you cherish, particularly those in their mid-40s to 50s, and equip them with the tools to assert control over their health journey through menopause.

🙌 Symptoms or not, everyone is welcome to explore a diverse toolkit of available pathways and embrace modern advancements for a smoother transition.  

#perimenopause #womenshealth #hormones

data.text:
Menopause Care “Devices & Virtual Care Platforms” + “Design-Led Engineering” is the key for "Increased Patient Adaptation"! While Menopause is no longer a hush-hush taboo, lack of resources & privacy are still resulting in care reservations & negligence.

The global #Menopause care market is huge, and lot of women can benefit from it! But studies suggest otherwise! 
 
👉 Only 1 in 5 women in the U.S. receive a referral to a menopause specialist and 
👉 Out of that 60% of women seek medical attention, 75% are left untreated! 
 
We strongly believe that “Business Bottlenecks are nothing but Digital Innovation Opportunities” & that is what Menopause Care did! 
 
Here are some of the top established and budding start-ups of Menopause Care devices & platforms that have taken this true-to-its-nature “Design-led engineering” approach & created a path for "Increased Patient Adaptation"! 

Devices: Embr Labs, ŌURA, Movano Health, Bellabeat, Incora Health, Amira Health

we’re hiring our first GTM expert to get the word out there to the 22 million women navigating nighttime hot flashes, introducing them to a solution crafted just for them!

At Amira, we’ve boldly applied engineering to revolutionize the antiquated and overlooked domain of menopause. Why? Because women deserve better than laying awake with a bag of frozen veggies for relief.

We’re seeking an industry maven to lead our product launch and fortify our GTM framework, ensuring a steady stream of customer insights.

You’re the ideal candidate if you:
• Have wielded GTM magic for small, early-stage startups (0-1)
• Have launched female-forward consumer brands under time-constraint
• Have orchestrated marketing flywheels for these brands
• Possess unparalleled insight into this underserved market
• Cherish the words “low CAC” like old friends

Part-time & remote at first, full-time depending on fit and results. Learn more about Amira at https://amira.care/

If you know someone who's a superstar at this, or mission aligned with women's health, talk to us! You can reach out directly to hello@amira.care.

data.text:
🌿✨ The revolution in menopause management is here! Pre-orders for Terra are now OPEN!

Terra is your wearable device offering personalized relief for menopause symptoms through smart temperature control and sleep improvement features.

And guess what? Pre-ordering Terra brings a special surprise – meet Amy, your digital menopause assistant, ready to guide, support, and empower you every step of the way. 🌟

Ready to join the revolution? Pre-order Terra and unlock your journey towards a more empowered menopause:

https://lnkd.in/gNJ8Vs8H
.
.
.
#terra #amira #menopause #femtech #womensupportingwomen #productlaunch

You know you're making a meaningful impact when no one else in the room looks like you. 

That was us at CES, a team of young women and men engineering in menopause, starting with women's sleep - a stark contrast to the predominantly suited male attendees. 

This week at CES was monumental for Amira. Not only was it our first time attending and exhibiting, but we also unveiled the long-awaited Terra product: a wearable system that makes you feel empowered by ensuring uninterrupted sleep through the worst nightly discomfort—hot flashes. By predicting hot flashes and providing instant cooling relief, Terra helps you stay asleep. 

It was a week full of adventures, from almost shutting down the Oakland airport due to transporting a suspicious item (our hot flash vest) to hosting a yoga class at our booth for anyone in need of a stretching session. We were featured in The Wall Street Journal and MedCity News, gained our first customers, and pitched Terra to over 500 booth visitors.  

I was pleasantly surprised by the number of husbands who stopped by to express to us that Terra would be ideal for their wives. We heard comments like "I bought her a little fan, but I bet this will be much better."; "This is awesome, not only it will keep her asleep but I also get to sleep!". Shoutout to the man who stopped by to learn more for his ex-wife who had suffered from hot flashes.

Exhibiting alongside other companies leveraging AI to address long-ignored issues was rewarding. The attention we received at our booth confirmed the amplitude of this problem, the suffering of women, and the interest in finding effective relief.

Lastly, I was fortunate to connect with people from different corners of the world—a perk of speaking multiple languages at a diverse conference. :) 

All to say, our first CES was a success and unforgettable. If you or anyone you know is suffering from sleep deprivation due to nighttime hot flashes, let them know that Terra pre-orders are live. (https://lnkd.in/eHiEQfp8) Worth noting that turns out hot flashes are not only caused during menopause but could also be a symptom during pregnancy, after COVID, and undergoing cancer chemical treatment.

Shoutout to the amazing founding team: Loewen Cavill, Felipe Radovitzky, Emilio Sison, & Claire Traweek.

#ces2024 #genai #hotflashes #womenshealth

author.headline: Founder, Alya Health. Helping you heal your gut with bioactive olive oil.

data.text:
🚀 It was a great evening filled with MIT alumni and investors at the Presidio in SF! A huge thank you to all who joined us!

🔥 We had an incredible fireside chat delving into Vinayak Ramesh's entrepreneurial journey with Ikigai. Moderated by Robert Harrington from SBXi, the discussion covered Ramesh's MIT Sandbox Innovation Fund Program experience, their recent $25M funding round, and insights into the evolving landscape of AI.

🌆 Anna Sun's pitch on how Nowadays (YC S23) leverages AI for corporate event planning hit home for an audience that is active in planning events!

⚕ Felipe Radovitzky's presentation about Amira Health's solution for women’s health, targeting hot flashes and sleep improvement, showcased impactful advancements in healthcare technology.

🌐 Our esteemed feedback panel—Marissa Bertorelli from Polaris Partners, Eddie Eltoukhy from Pear VC, and Vinayak Ramesh from Ikigai—provided invaluable insights and guidance to the presenting companies.

It was an exceptional evening filled with groundbreaking ideas, insightful conversations, and valuable connections. Thank you to everyone involved in making this event a success. We can't wait for the next one!

#Innovation #MIT #TechEvents #Networking #AI #HealthcareTech #Startups

Where do AI and technology thrive?

In the realm of high complexity. And there's no more intricate phase of life than menopause, with over 48+ symptoms and a mere 1500 menopause providers.

Medicine 3.0, a term coined by Dr. Peter Attia, aligns with Amira's journey. Amira signifies the shift to Medicine 3.0, where data-driven, proactive care is fueled by mathematics and advanced tools, unlocking the full potential of proactive healthcare.

So, how does Amira Health bring this vision to life? Our AI Coach, Amy, is breaking barriers—she's redefining how we approach menopause by democratizing expert care. Women are choosing Amy for intimate discussions, revealing the true power of tech in navigating this life-changing transition. 🌟

Read the full story here expertly encapsulated by Kamili Wilson.

data.text: Congrats Loewen Cavill, Felipe Radovitzky, and Emilio Sison!

Case Story 07: Bringing Comfort to Menopausal Women, with Amira Health (2023)

I've heard horror stories about the menopause. The hot flashes, the mood swings, the overwhelming discomfort of living in your body as it goes through this natural transition. Even the show Fleabag has an interesting take on why women should look forward to it: https://lnkd.in/ghrjzsZA

The Amira Health team initially approached us with stories of their relatives going through the hell of menopause and finding little relief from online searches and doctors' recommendations: apps, herbal remedies, changes of lifestyle, and, in the most extreme cases, hormonal therapy. Most women end up standing in front of their refrigerators for instant relief when hot flashes appear unannounced at night.

To help with nighttime hot flashes, the Amira team created a system that senses a hot flash approaching through a wrist wearable, then sends a signal to a hub that rushes cold water to a mattress pad underneath the woman's chest. The woman can now enjoy an undisturbed night's sleep and tackle the next day with more energy and peace.

When Nonfiction designed the wearable, we took inspiration from the natural world:

1. Earth
As a brand color, we chose terracotta instead of the non-commital grayscale/ pink/baby blue that often graces "feminine" tech. Terracotta is an abundant natural material that keeps things cool, like water urns in Ancient Greece. It is also a distinctive color that complements many skin tones.

2. Tides
Just like tides rush over our coasts every passing day, the rush of cold water takes over a woman's body to cancel out nighttime hot flashes. Tides exist to support the natural world and make it flourish. Cooling a woman's body replaces the overwhelming heat and sweat with instant relief so she can properly rest through the night.

3. Moon
We can't talk about tides without discussing the influence of the Moon. The Moon has been the symbol of womanhood for millennia. When a woman's cycle experiences chaos (menopause), the roundness and reliability of the Moon's cycle remain supportive. This is why we wanted to make the wearable round, soft, like a pillow, always there to remind the woman that there is order in this world.

4. Celestial Influence
Like mass distorts the fabric of the universe, there is fluidity in how one shape connects to the next. So, instead of designing electrodes that look tacked onto a surface, we made them look like celestial bodies influencing each other. The wavy lines make that influence visually evident and elegant.

What we learned: When dealing with feelings of discomfort, inadequacy, and shame, it is important to return to the natural world and be inspired by how compassionate design helps us be kinder to ourselves.

Learn more about Amira Health: https://www.amira.care/ 

Creative Direction: Phnam Bagley
Team: Mardis Bagley, Fifile Nguyen, Weronika (Vera) Banas, Aigerim A. Mutlu

It’s been 9 months since my last post about a pivotal career decision generated over 1M impressions.

I thought I owed an update at least to the hundreds of people who reached out to help. 

After getting many offers, it became evident that none aligned with my values or brought me closer to my aspiration.

In search of a network of like-minded individuals, I decided to build that community of female founders in San Francisco dedicated to advancing women's health.

At my first event, I had the pleasure of hosting one of the brightest female founders, Loewen Cavill, Founder & CEO of Amira, as a speaker. Our conversation revealed a clear synergy, paving the way for a collaborative opportunity.

Now, I'm happy to announce that I'm joining the incredible team of engineers at Amira as the first full-time hire to lead their GTM efforts and diving into everything I'm passionate about: being scrappy, iterating, hustling—basically, doing it all!

Not only am I gaining exposure in building from the ground up, but also contribute to making women's lives at least 1% better, starting with their sleep.

I've always believed that technological innovations have outpaced advancements in women's health, and the key lies in bridging these realms to elevate care across every stage of a woman's hormonal lifecycle.

Looking ahead, catch me obsessively crafting a super routine geared towards achieving greatness and seizing every learning opportunity. My focus will be on positioning Amira as the foremost technologist in menopause care.

If you’re currently or had previously led similar efforts at a similar stage & have some piece of wisdom to share, please reach out!

(ps: enjoy some footage on the field!)🤓

#womenshealth #womeninai #menopausecoach #menopause

Last night I had the pleasure of running into a few very cherished friends of mine at the MIT delta v Investor Day Showcase in Mountain View. These three were among my first mentors and role-models as entrepreneurs when we were kickstarting market research and forming a business plan for Amira Health back in 2020 during delta v.

Three years later and these guys continue to inspire, tremendously.

So excited for Paul Cheek's upcoming release of his book "Startup Tactics", Kosta L.'s remarkable journey ahead with Stavvy, and Bill Aulet for continuing to lead as the symbol of MIT's startup community.

It really puts a smile on your face to see old friends keep growing and crush it doing what they love.

Shoutout to the Martin Trust Center for MIT Entrepreneurship for the great Investor Showcase event and for continuing to foster an incredible environment for aspiring entrepreneurs.

data.text:
Last month, I had a blast hosting two fun events for TechCrunch Disrupt After Hours in San Francisco.

🤖 The first panel had over 600 signups and featured three different perspectives on the future of AI / LLMs: 

📈 the investor's: ​Arpan Shah – Partner at Pear VC 
🧪 the scientist's: ​Antoine Dedieu – AI Researcher at Google DeepMind
🤝 the entrepreneur's: ​Dhruv Amin & Marcus Lowe – co-founders of Create (and proud Codi members!)

Antoine walked us through the technical limitations of LLMs, while Arpan shared his confidence that tech giants are not a threat to new AI startups (except if you're building a search engine!). Dhruv and Marcus, pioneering Gen AI-powered app development, showed some creative use cases of how people and companies are leveraging their AI platform.

📣 The second event was a female founders-only happy hour. We saw eight demos of innovative products built by incredible women and addressing traditionally overlooked challenges such as menopause, painful periods, or childcare. A big thank you to Sofiia Shvets - Claid, Julia Layton - Sundaze Heated Shorts, Andrea Chang - Beami, Loewen Cavill - Amira Health, ​Claire Xie - ClinkAI, ​Mahsoo Salimi - Sentire, Jana Schellong - beams, and Meredith DePaolo - Carrots&Cake. 

I walked out of both rooms inspired and excited for the future of AI and female-founder-led innovation! 

#AI #LLMS #TechCrunchDisrupt #FemaleFounders

At Nonfiction, we turn science fiction into reality for a better future.
What we do as a design and innovation firm can appear overwhelming from the outside, so I'd like to spend the next month posting 14 case stories about our work and its impact on society and the environment.

Yes, we call them "case stories" instead of "case studies" because I'm not here to bore you with the intricate details of each project, but rather tell stories about what makes them powerful and inspiring.

In our seven years of existence, we've created countless innovative design solutions that are unique, rich in intellectual property, and profoundly human. What's extra special about Nonfiction is that we do all that on and off-planet, thanks to my background in space architecture.

We are agnostic when it comes to the industries we tackle. What's more important is for our clients to think deeply about the impact their solution offers the world. So far, our projects cover 15 of the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals. We're missing SDG 14 (Life Below Water) and SDG 15 (Life on Land) in case you're wondering.

I hope you enjoy the case stories. Feel free to ask questions, share posts, follow Nonfiction, and contact us if you want to discuss your next world-changing project.

Website: https://lnkd.in/gyQMkBmD
Video series: https://lnkd.in/g4rmuD6e

data.text:
Super excited to announce Women of Wearables (wearables, health tech & femtech)'s next week's #FemTechExpo session about #menopause and #agingtech! 🔥

Our community and attendees will have the opportunity to hear and learn from: 

📌 Bayer G4A - Bayer’s digital health partnerships and investments team dedicated to scaling digital health companies in order to create impact and change the experience of health. 

📌 Isaac Health - a platform for brain health and dementia population management. 

📌 Ani Biome - revolutionizing the longevity industry with cutting-edge AI-driven metabolic engineering and personalized health solutions. 

📌 Femmar supports women through their menopause journey at midlife from Perimenopause, Menopause and beyond.  

📌 Amira Health - a menopausal healthcare platform leveraging wearable technology and AI. 

📌 Science&Humans (S&H) - a consumer-first digital platform for hormone health treatments, testing and consults that supports women experiencing symptoms of peri-menopause and menopause. 

📌 Joylux, Inc offers a platform of life-changing solutions with high-tech devices, digital tools and products that address intimate health concerns. 

📌 Hormmony by Prelude Health's rapid hormone tests and AI-tailored health profiles plus behavioral psychology provide women+ in their mid-years with the information they need to lead happier, healthier lives. 

📌 Partnered with over 80 brands including Boots, QVC, Next and Holland & Barrett, GenM Official is working to transform menopause by empowering brands to understand & and support this audience. 

📌 The #FemAging Project by Denise Pines provides health and tech industry leaders and investors with research, strategy, education, and intelligence that helps drive global innovation focused on the health and wellness needs of women ages 40+.

Many thanks to our program and event partners Bayer G4A Jenny Wüstner for their support of this event! 🙏🏽

Register for your ticket here ➡️ https://lnkd.in/eyahaKMp

Find out more on our blog below 👇🏽

https://lnkd.in/epw-rmA9

resharedPost.text:
In the US, 40+ million women are experiencing symptoms of menopause.

Yet, it remains a black box for physicians & most importantly, for women. 

This means that women can’t get effective care. The few experts in this field have year+ long waitlists, leaving women hopeless and helpless.

Amira is a women-led team of MIT engineers pioneering technical innovation in menopause, transitioning this phase of life into one of a newfound renaissance of empowerment. 

Amira is excited to announce Amy, the first text-based AI Menopause Health Coach built to fill the void in expert menopausal care making it affordable and accessible to all women.

Amy is your personal, instant expert - guiding women through this uncertain phase of life, shedding light on how they can take control of their own health. She’s designed to understand you & your unique experience to redirect you down the optimal path.

In honor of Menopause Awareness Month, we are giving free access to Amy to all women seeking guidance & support. 💙✨

Help us spread the word by sharing this post so that it reaches those millions of women who deserve better care. 

#MenopauseSupport #EmpowerWomen #MeetAmy #MenopauseAwarenessMonth

data.text:
So excited to announce Amira's launch of Amy, the world's first AI menopause health coach.

Our team has worked extremely hard to turn this vision into reality. If you feel compelled to support us and our new product, please share this video with any women 40+ that you know!

You can also have them send a text message to Amy at +1 (541) 906-3143 or visit our webpage: https://www.amira.care/amy.

resharedPost.text:
80% of women in menopause struggle with hot flashes and sleep disruption, exerting a massive toll on their health, emotional well-being, mood, quality of life, productivity, and more. We founded Amira to change this reality.

Starting with improving women’s sleep, we are reimagining how women experience this stage of their lives with a new, data-driven approach. We have pioneered the first hot-flash detecting wearable and bed-cooling system designed to eliminate sleep disruption from hot flashes, and we are building the first AI-powered chatbot that provides women with guidance on how to deal with their menopause symptoms.

Now backed by Supermoon Capital and E14 Fund, we are #hiring talented and ambitious individuals. Join the San Francisco team as we fast-track our groundbreaking wearable sleep improvement system.

For more information, take a look at our careers page linked below.

https://lnkd.in/gaUjVn94

#womendeservebetter #menopausecare #hotflashes #wellness

data.text:
Amira is hiring! Calling all software engineers passionate about making an impact in women's healthcare. We are growing rapidly before our launch in Q2 2024.

Please share with any Senior Full-Stack or Backend Software Engineers in your network!

Had such a blast hanging out with Felipe Radovitzky and Claire Traweek of Amira Health over the weekend in SF! It is always so insightful to meet with fellow hardware companies to share the woes, highs and challenges of building physical products that make a difference. 
Amira is creating a revolutionary product for tackling menopause symptoms, shining a light on a huge target audience so often overlooked. And they have their own office Reflect Innovation Orb! 
Loewen Cavill you were missed and I'm sure our paths will cross soon enough!

#hardware #startups #healthtech

data.text:
Have you ever attended a networking event where women outnumbered men?

If so, you know that there was something extraordinary in the air. It's an electric atmosphere filled with boundless energy, infectious excitement, burning passion, unwavering ambition, and an undeniable sense of power.

This energy is a testament to the collective force of hard-working women in tech who are not only dedicated to their careers but also deeply committed to a space that has long been undervalued: women's health. These women are breaking barriers, driving innovation, and transforming the landscape of healthcare for women.

I am personally captivated by this emerging energy, and as a community builder and marketer, I feel compelled to channel and celebrate it. That's why I'm thrilled to announce an event that will bring together inspiring women in the tech industry who are making waves in women's health.

Join us for a one-of-a-kind gathering where you'll connect with like-minded individuals, share experiences, and explore the vast opportunities in the thriving women's health sector. It's a chance to learn from visionary leaders, including Loewen Cavill, Founder & CEO of Amira, a pioneering menopause care startup, and Sujude D., a distinguished VC Investor at Jazz Venture Partners.

If you resonate with this, if you feel the fire within you to make a difference in women's health, then I wholeheartedly invite you to be part of this event. Let's harness our collective power, fuel our ambitions, and drive meaningful change in this vital space.

Together, we can elevate the importance of women's health, break down barriers, and empower future generations of women in tech.

#WomenInTech #WomenInHealth #founders #innovation

data.text:
Last week, we had the pleasure of hosting an intimate, open discussion about our panel members' and audience's experience with menopause and different approaches to improving women's wellness during this transition. We discussed hormones, nutrition, the taboo of menopause (and how we can eliminate this taboo), improving sleep, and much more!

Check out the full event recap on our Instagram: https://lnkd.in/gJYp4YY5

Thank you to all of our lovely guests for coming ❤️ Your presence made our event truly special and impactful. We are grateful for the engaging conversations, shared stories, and the sense of community we felt throughout the evening.

The support and enthusiasm we received from each and every one of you only reaffirms the importance of raising awareness about menopausal health. Together, we are breaking down barriers, destigmatizing menopause, and empowering women to embrace this transformative stage of life.

A big shout-out to our incredible panel members Nimisha Gandhi, Silvia Young and Dr. Sandy Lê for sharing their expertise and personal journeys. Your insights and knowledge were invaluable, and we are grateful for your dedication to women's health. 

As we move forward, we promise to continue providing valuable resources, events, and products to support women on their menopausal journey. Stay tuned to hear about upcoming events and exciting product updates that will further enhance your well-being during this phase.

Once again, thank you to everyone who joined us. Your presence made a difference, and we can't wait to see you at our next event. Together, we will keep championing menopausal health and celebrating the strength and resilience of women. 💪💙

#MenopausalHealth #BreakingTaboos #WomenEmpowerment #EmbracingChange #GratefulCommunity #StayTuned

Join us this Thursday in San Francisco as we host a panel discussion on menopausal health and wellbeing! Topics will include hormone imbalance, nutrition, managing physical changes during menopause, emotional and mental well-being, long-term health and wellness, seeking support and resources, and overcoming the stigma of menopause.

We are excited to welcome the following speakers to our panel:

- Dr. Sandy Lê from Radiant Health
- Silvia Young, founder of FemTruth Youth
- Nimisha Gandhi, founder of Moon Cycle Nutrition

The discussion will be moderated by Loewen Cavill, our cofounder and CEO.

To register for the event, visit the link below:

https://lnkd.in/g9zGK_GW

The event is private and password-protected, so please reach out if you or anyone you know is interested in joining!

#menopause #wellness #nutrition #mentalhealth #sanfrancisco

data.text:
🚀 E14 Fund Startup Showcase! 🚀
Last week at MIT Media Lab, the E14 Fund showcased 13 groundbreaking startups, with live demos and introductions. A fantastic event with 300+ attendees - corporate sponsors, students and faculty!

🌟 Companies that presented:
1️⃣ OPT Industries: Functional metamaterials products that close the design, manufacture, scale loop
2️⃣ Ubicept: Pushing camera tech boundaries for mobility & more.
3️⃣ Sourcemap: the Supply Chain Transparency Company: Supply chain visibility software tackling complex challenges.
4️⃣ SiTration, Inc.: Pioneering a sustainable process for lithium-ion battery recycling.
5️⃣ FIGUR8, Inc.: First musculoskeletal diagnostics decision support system.
6️⃣ Wise Systems, Inc.: Streamlining last-mile delivery with machine learning-driven platform.
7️⃣ Themis AI: Risk Aware AI Workflow for trust, explainability, robustness, and fairness in AI.
8️⃣ Central Casting AI: Pretrained models for AI behavior & dialogue in game engines.
9️⃣ Amira Health: Precision health monitoring and AI for predictive healthcare in menopause.
🔟 Ikigai Labs: No/low code platform for building AI apps.
1️⃣1️⃣ Ontologic: Cloud-based platform for user-generated code in cutting-edge research.
1️⃣2️⃣ Capra Biosciences: Sustainable chemical production of petrochemical replacements from waste carbon.
1️⃣3️⃣ Formlabs: 3D printing technology developer and manufacturer.

Next one in October! 🌐👏

#E14Fund #MIT #MITMediaLab #Startups #Innovation #Technology #Entrepreneurship

data.text: It was an honor to be given the platform to speak about Amira’s mission and progress towards reinventing menopause with the 400+ in attendance at Matter Health’s Menopause Accelerator. Menopause is finally starting to receive serious attention, ushering in a new wave of innovation. This is in large part thanks to the women in these photos. Thank you to all the fellow innovators for dedicating your lives to changing the reality of menopause. And of course, major thank you to the mentors and the 51labs team for creating the ecosystem and support required to unlock the potential of these pioneers.

What better way to celebrate our 200th FemTech Focus podcast episode than invite our followers, believers, and femfans to own a piece of our new company, FemHealth Insights! As the leaders in women's health market research, we are energized to revolutionize femhealth with data, insights, and custom consulting. 

There's only $50K left on our WeFunder! Get in for as little as $100 bc #accessibility --> https://lnkd.in/g5tgxwFf

How our Femtech-version of CB Insights will benefit you:

Femtech Founders - the platform will be available to you for free! We know the lack of data is a huge pain point. We also have clients looking to acquire and invest. We will connect you to these opportunities!

Investors - get accurate market landscape reports, insightful comparables, and useful market values. Raise your fund with strong data, invest with confidence, and discover new deals. 

Pharma/MedTech - Your business development and corporate innovation teams will go crazy for data that is accurate and expansive. Find acquisition targets and white space in women's health to expand your offerings strategically. 

Gov/Banks/Foundations/Media/Retail/Everyone!  - there's so many entities that will benefit from insightful data on the past, present, and future of female health and wellness. Understand your customer, navigate the competitive landscape, and executive a data-driven strategy to increase your profits while doing right by women globally. 

I am so excited for the future of FemHealth Insights. The time for women's health innovation is NOW. Let's Go!!!

We are excited to announce we have rebranded to Amira. The name Amira better represents our holistic approach towards menopause+ health with nighttime hot flashes just being our beginning. Amira is Hebrew for ‘treetop’ and mira is Spanish for ‘sight’. Amira symbolizes the treetop-level, full-picture view of health and wellness we give women through our menopause+ care platform.
